section.title: Present continuous
section.sectiontitle: We use subject + be + verb + -ing to talk about actions happening now/around now. We usually use the short form.
section.text1: happening now: I am using the computer at the moment.
section.text1a: I'm using the computer at the moment.
section.text2: happening around now: He is staying in Mexico this week.
section.sectiontitle2: In the negative, we use subject + be + not + verb + -ing. We usually use the short form.
section.text4: They are not living in the UK.

section.title: Present continuous questions and short answers
section.sectiontitle: To make the question, we use be + subject + -ing.
section.text1a: Is he working now? Yes, he is.
section.text2a: Are you watching that film? No I'm not.
section.sectiontitle2: Notice the spelling of the -ing form.
section.text3: Verbs ending with -e: live, come, leave
section.text4: Verbs ending consonant + vowel + consonant: sit, run
